action_space.name: Case Conceptualization & Diagnosis
action_space.goal: Develop and continuously refine a cognitive understanding of the patient’s difficulties to guide individualized treatment.
action_space.description: Integrate assessment data, history, presenting problems, and patterns of thoughts/beliefs/behaviors into an evolving, patient-specific formulation.

micro_actions.name: Identify Presenting Problems
micro_actions.description: Elicit and document specific difficulties or complaints motivating the patient to seek therapy.

micro_actions.name: Assess History & Developmental Factors
micro_actions.description: Gather data on developmental events, prior experiences, and their impact on core/intermediate beliefs.

micro_actions.name: Specify Core & Intermediate Beliefs
micro_actions.description: Elicit, infer, and validate rigid global beliefs and underlying assumptions from patient narratives.

micro_actions.name: Map Cognitive Model to Current Issues
micro_actions.description: Relate automatic thoughts, feelings, and behaviors in specific problem situations to core/intermediate beliefs.

action_space.name: Therapeutic Relationship Building
action_space.goal: Establish and maintain an effective, collaborative alliance as a foundation for CBT.
action_space.description: Engage in empathic, collaborative, and responsive interactions that foster trust, safety, and motivation.

micro_actions.name: Demonstrate Empathy and Understanding
micro_actions.description: Reflect feelings, validate concerns, express warmth and genuine regard.

micro_actions.name: Collaborative Decision-Making
micro_actions.description: Elicit patient opinions and preferences, cocreate agenda, and negotiate priorities in session and therapy plan.

micro_actions.name: Elicit and Respond to Feedback
micro_actions.description: Encourage honest reactions to therapist, session, or techniques; positively reinforce feedback even if negative.

action_space.name: Problem-Oriented Agenda Setting & Behavioral Activation
action_space.goal: Address high-priority patient problems and facilitate engagement in adaptive activities for mood improvement.
action_space.description: Set clear session agendas; support and structure patient activity scheduling & problem solving.

micro_actions.name: Set/Negotiate the Session Agenda
micro_actions.description: Jointly determine which problems to address; name rather than describe items; prioritize as needed.

micro_actions.name: Review and Assign Activity Scheduling
micro_actions.description: Guide patient to specify, plan, and commit to concrete mastery/pleasure activities; use charts and ratings.

micro_actions.name: Set and Review Homework
micro_actions.description: Assign between-session tasks tailored to patient needs, support adherence, and address obstacles collaboratively.

action_space.name: Cognitive/Behavioral Skill Training & Cognitive Restructuring
action_space.goal: Teach skills for identifying, evaluating, and responding to dysfunctional thinking and building behavioral repertoire.
action_space.description: Deliver psychoeducation, demonstrate and practice techniques to build CBT competencies and autonomy.

micro_actions.name: Psychoeducation of Cognitive Model
micro_actions.description: Teach patients how thoughts, feelings, and behaviors interrelate, using their own examples and visual aids.

micro_actions.name: Elicit and Differentiate Automatic Thoughts/Emotions
micro_actions.description: Help patient identify specific automatic thoughts, distinguish from feelings, and rate their intensity.

micro_actions.name: Socratic Questioning/Guided Discovery
micro_actions.description: Lead patient through structured evaluation of thoughts/beliefs using Socratic methods.

micro_actions.name: Conduct Behavioral Experiments
micro_actions.description: Formulate and test predictions about thoughts/behaviors in real contexts or via in/vivo/in-session experiments.

micro_actions.name: Teach and Practice Coping/Skillful Behaviors
micro_actions.description: Model, role-play, and rehearse new skills (assertiveness, problem solving, relaxation, etc.).

action_space.name: Belief and Schema Work
action_space.goal: Modify maladaptive core/intermediate beliefs to support sustained emotional and behavioral change.
action_space.description: Systematically elicit, test, and restructure deeper-level beliefs using cognitive, experiential, and behavioral methods.

micro_actions.name: Downward Arrow Technique
micro_actions.description: Use sequential questioning to uncover the meaning and underlying beliefs driving distress.

micro_actions.name: Cognitive Continuum Technique
micro_actions.description: Use scaling or rating to help patients recognize non-binary, moderate alternatives to rigid beliefs.

micro_actions.name: Core Belief Worksheet/Tracking
micro_actions.description: Have patients systematically gather and reframe evidence for and against old/new beliefs.

micro_actions.name: Imagery and Experiential Re-Scripting
micro_actions.description: Guide imaginal revisiting of key memories to support belief change at an emotional level.

action_space.name: Termination, Relapse Prevention, and Follow-Up
action_space.goal: Consolidate gains, build resilience, and prepare patients to apply CBT tools independently after therapy.
action_space.description: Review progress, anticipate setbacks, collaboratively plan for maintenance, and facilitate self-therapy skills.

micro_actions.name: Review Progress/Self-Efficacy
micro_actions.description: Attribution of change to patient effort and consolidation of self-therapist identity.

micro_actions.name: Develop Relapse Prevention Plan
micro_actions.description: Help patient anticipate potential setbacks, create coping cards, and agree on booster/self-therapy procedures.

micro_actions.name: Terminate & Plan Booster Sessions
micro_actions.description: Gradually space sessions, reinforce review of therapy notes/skills, and schedule follow-ups as needed.

Conversation_states.Description: Current subjective intensity of predominant emotion(s) (depression, anxiety, anger, etc.), tracked across session to monitor affect and guide intervention.
Degree of patient’s awareness of automatic thoughts in the current or discussed situation. Higher awareness enables more effective intervention.
Patient’s conviction in a specific (core or intermediate) belief, both at an 'intellectual' and 'emotional/gut' level; used to track change over time.
Level of patient collaboration, participation, and effort within session (agenda-setting, problem-identification, feedback, etc.).
Quality of trust, rapport, and emotional bond between therapist and patient; correlated with treatment outcome.
Level of distress associated with a specific situation, thought, or memory targeted in the session.
Patient's completion of between-session tasks (planned behavioral & cognitive assignments).
Amount of participation in adaptive/mastery/pleasure activities relevant to goals/values.
Proportion of planned/priority session topics addressed effectively.
Whether explicit patient feedback (positive/negative, concerns, alliance signals, misunderstandings) has been received for the current session.
Degree to which a specific negative (or positive) core belief is activated in the current session/context.
Conversation_states.Values: 0 (not at all activated) – 1 (fully activated/present in experience)

Conversation_states.Description: Presence and intensity of avoidance or safety behaviors interfering with treatment or behavioral exposure.
Where in the therapy process the session fits; relevant for expectations, focus, and intervention type.
List of current prioritized problems/issues that patient wants help with this session.

knowledge_graph.description: Root node representing the individual in therapy. All knowledge and memory in CBT are organized under this node.
Patient's current DSM or clinical diagnosis, relevant for guiding treatment and understanding symptoms.
Specific issues, complaints, or difficulties motivating the patient to seek therapy.
Patient's therapeutic goals and desired outcomes, collaboratively set and revisited over time.
Global, rigid, deeply held beliefs about self, others, or the world; underlying much dysfunctional thinking.
Rules, attitudes, and assumptions that stem from core beliefs and guide perceptions and behavior.
Situation-specific, often brief and unexamined thoughts or images that mediate between beliefs and emotional/behavioral reactions.
Emotional states associated with situations, thoughts, and beliefs, tracked for intensity and pattern changes.
Observable actions, responses or avoidance patterns linked to thoughts and emotions.
Patient’s existing skills, positive qualities, values, and coping strategies.
Key historical or developmental experiences shaping core/intermediate beliefs and current functioning.
Behavioral or cognitive methods (adaptive/maladaptive) used to manage distress or beliefs.
Skills, resources, and action plans for maintaining therapeutic gains and managing setbacks post-therapy.
Summaries of significant events, interventions, homework, patient feedback, and therapy outcomes across and within sessions.
